verbs.description: fractionate (third-person singular simple present fractionates, present participle fractionating, simple past and past participle fractionated)

entries.meaning: (chemistry) To separate (a mixture) into its individual constituents by exploiting differences in some chemical or physical property, such as boiling point, particle size, solubility etc.
examples: Crude oil is fractionated in a refinery to produce a number of different petroleum products.

entries.meaning: (radiotherapy) To divide a total dose of radiation into fractions.
(cryptography) To divide each plaintext symbol into several ciphertext symbols as a preliminary stage of encryption.
To use the technique of fractionation in hypnosis.
